Package org.hiphap

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hiphap.UserManager
  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the singleton pattern to allow easy User authentication, and management from any point within the system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addUser​(User user)
      Adds a new User object to the system.
      boolean authenticate​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Checks a username and password combination against the ones stored in the system.
      boolean deleteUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Removes a User from the system by searching for a matching username
      User getCurrentUser()
      Gets the currently logged in User
      static UserManager getInstance()  
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUsernames()
      Gets an ArrayList of all the usernames registered on the system
      boolean isAuthenticated()
      Check whether any User is currently logged in
      boolean isUsernameTaken​(java.lang.String username)
      Check whether the username is already registered on the system
      boolean loadUserData()
      Loads the contents from the data file into the internal ArrayList.
      void logout()
      Log the current user out of the system
      void saveUserData()
      Writes the contents of the internal ArrayList into the data file.

      • getInstance

        public static UserManager getInstance()

      • getUsernames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getUsernames()
        Gets an ArrayList of all the usernames registered on the system
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of all usernames

      • addUser

        public void addUser​(User user)
        Adds a new User object to the system.
        Parameters:
        user - the User object to be added

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Gets the currently logged in User
        Returns:
        the currently logged in User. Can only be null on the login screen

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate​(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password)
        Checks a username and password combination against the ones stored in the system. If a match is found, that User is set as the currently logged in user.
        Parameters:
        username - a String username to search for
        password - a String password to authenticate with
        Returns:
        true if login was successful

      • isUsernameTaken

        public boolean isUsernameTaken​(java.lang.String username)
        Check whether the username is already registered on the system
        Parameters:
        username - a String representation of the username
        Returns:
        true if the username is already registered on the system

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Removes a User from the system by searching for a matching username
        Parameters:
        username - a String representation of the username to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the User was successfully removed.

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
        Check whether any User is currently logged in
        Returns:
        true if a User is logged in

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Log the current user out of the system

      • loadUserData

        public boolean loadUserData()
        Loads the contents from the data file into the internal ArrayList.

      • saveUserData

        public void saveUserData()
        Writes the contents of the internal ArrayList into the data file.
